ygData.subject: Re: Guild name and charter
ygData.msgSnippet: I used to be in a guild that was pretty cool, it was called Cult Arcanum we liked it. Rhonda ... From: Vatigerboy  To:
ygData.messageBody:
I used to be in a guild that was pretty cool, it was called "Cult Arcanum"
we liked it.

Rhonda
----- Original Message -----
From: Vatigerboy <vatigerboy@...>
To: <EQ_rainbow@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, July 29, 1999 12:18 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_rainbow] Guild name and charter


> From: Vatigerboy <vatigerboy@...>
>
> Well Synergy isn't even in the Thesaurus, hehe. I still like "Keepers of
the
> Unknown"
>
>
> Tiger
>
>
>
> WAMPIR@... wrote:
>
> > From: WAMPIR@...
> >
> > Hello everyone
> >
> > My 2cp I like Force of synergy, better than any I have seen as of yet. I
> > defently cant see my Dark Elf Necro with a guild tital of Spirit of
Harmony.
> > I would be laughted out of Nektulos forest if I showed up with that next
to
> > my name.
> >
> > Wampir
> >
> > In a message dated 7/29/99 9:42:14 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
josephn@...
> > writes:
> >
> > << Well,
> >
> > Spirit of Harmony is of course still a possibility, but as I pointed
out
> > last night in the chat, the name implies such a "goody-goody" theme
that
> > "evil" and maybe even "neutral" chacrhters would seem silly in the
giuld.
> > therefore the poeple who remianed in the chat last night tried ot thik
of
> > somehting that would not imply a good-oriented nature to the guild, but
> > rather a neutral orientation. Force of synergy can be taken in many
> > ways....synergy is the joining of energy or ideas, therefore the titlew
> > can be seen as the coming togethe of the ideas outlined in the charter,
as
> > well as the energy of the poeple in the guild working towards the goals
> > outlined in the charter. In this sense even a dark elf neromancer,
could
> > join our guild and seek the mutual respect or "tolerance"
> > of all members as well as the poeple of Norrath at large. this dosnt
> > mean this Dark elf necro has to necesarily like or love the wood elves
> > around, just respect and elarn from them as the charter describes.
> >
> > I understand that these ideas may not work for everyone, but i think
that
> > "spirit of harmony" would work even less for people.
> >
> > In my personal case my 12th lvl Wizard (Fentus) is a neutral-good
> > charchter who would not want to join a guild that seeks Harmony between
> > all people (he just dose not see this as relaistic or practical) but a
> > guild that prmotes respect for poeple would be fine (especially since
the
> > diversity he would then encouter could benefit him in his search for
> > knowledge)
> >
> > Lastly, this guild name and charter would not necessarily be good for
the
> > evilest of evil, though they would be wecome to join. but i dont think
we
> > could createa guild that would be ok for EVERYONE. But spirit of
Harmony
> > would be a step in the opposite direction. >>
> >
